result.execSummary:
The defendant Nhia Xiong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nhia Xiong is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Nhia Xiong was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nhia Xiong is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Nhia Xiong was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Nhia Xiong was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

He may not make any telephone calls to the Clerk of Courts office for any reason.  He may write letters to the Clerk of Court's office.  If he thinks he has any business with the Clerk of Courts office, he may/must appear personally in the Clerk's office.  No contact with the victim.
Submit DNA sample.  Undergo a Mental Health Examination and follow through with recommendations.
